39#ifdef _WIN32
40 #include <winsock2.h>

43 #ifdef INET6
44 /*
45 * To quote the MSDN page for getaddrinfo() at
46 *
47 * https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms738520(v=vs.85).aspx
48 *
49 * "Support for getaddrinfo on Windows 2000 and older versions
50 * The getaddrinfo function was added to the Ws2_32.dll on Windows XP and
51 * later. To execute an application that uses this function on earlier
52 * versions of Windows, then you need to include the Ws2tcpip.h and
53 * Wspiapi.h files. When the Wspiapi.h include file is added, the
54 * getaddrinfo function is defined to the WspiapiGetAddrInfo inline
55 * function in the Wspiapi.h file. At runtime, the WspiapiGetAddrInfo
56 * function is implemented in such a way that if the Ws2_32.dll or the
57 * Wship6.dll (the file containing getaddrinfo in the IPv6 Technology
58 * Preview for Windows 2000) does not include getaddrinfo, then a
59 * version of getaddrinfo is implemented inline based on code in the
60 * Wspiapi.h header file. This inline code will be used on older Windows
61 * platforms that do not natively support the getaddrinfo function."
62 *
63 * We use getaddrinfo(), so we include Wspiapi.h here.
64 */
65 #include <wspiapi.h>
66 #endif /* INET6 */
67#else /* _WIN32 */

75 #ifdef HAVE_ETHER_HOSTTON
76 #if defined(NET_ETHERNET_H_DECLARES_ETHER_HOSTTON)
77 /*
78 * OK, just include <net/ethernet.h>.
79 */
80 #include <net/ethernet.h>
81 #elif defined(NETINET_ETHER_H_DECLARES_ETHER_HOSTTON)
82 /*
83 * OK, just include <netinet/ether.h>
84 */
85 #include <netinet/ether.h>
86 #elif defined(SYS_ETHERNET_H_DECLARES_ETHER_HOSTTON)
87 /*
88 * OK, just include <sys/ethernet.h>
89 */
90 #include <sys/ethernet.h>
91 #elif defined(ARPA_INET_H_DECLARES_ETHER_HOSTTON)
92 /*
93 * OK, just include <arpa/inet.h>
94 */
95 #include <arpa/inet.h>
96 #elif defined(NETINET_IF_ETHER_H_DECLARES_ETHER_HOSTTON)
97 /*
98 * OK, include <netinet/if_ether.h>, after all the other stuff we
99 * need to include or define for its benefit.
100 */
101 #define NEED_NETINET_IF_ETHER_H
102 #else
103 /*
104 * We'll have to declare it ourselves.
105 * If <netinet/if_ether.h> defines struct ether_addr, include
106 * it. Otherwise, define it ourselves.
107 */
108 #ifdef HAVE_STRUCT_ETHER_ADDR
109 #define NEED_NETINET_IF_ETHER_H
110 #else /* HAVE_STRUCT_ETHER_ADDR */
111 struct ether_addr {
112 unsigned char ether_addr_octet[6];
113 };
114 #endif /* HAVE_STRUCT_ETHER_ADDR */
115 #endif /* what declares ether_hostton() */
116
117 #ifdef NEED_NETINET_IF_ETHER_H
118 #include <net/if.h> /* Needed on some platforms */
119 #include <netinet/in.h> /* Needed on some platforms */
120 #include <netinet/if_ether.h>
121 #endif /* NEED_NETINET_IF_ETHER_H */
122
123 #ifndef HAVE_DECL_ETHER_HOSTTON
124 /*
125 * No header declares it, so declare it ourselves.
126 */
127 extern int ether_hostton(const char *, struct ether_addr *);
128 #endif /* !defined(HAVE_DECL_ETHER_HOSTTON) */
129 #endif /* HAVE_ETHER_HOSTTON */

151#ifndef NTOHL
152#define NTOHL(x) (x) = ntohl(x)
153#define NTOHS(x) (x) = ntohs(x)
154#endif
155
156/*
157 * Convert host name to internet address.
158 * Return 0 upon failure.
159 * XXX - not thread-safe; don't use it inside libpcap.
160 */
161bpf_u_int32 **
162pcap_nametoaddr(const char *name)
163{
164#ifndef h_addr
165 static bpf_u_int32 *hlist[2];
166#endif
167 bpf_u_int32 **p;
168 struct hostent *hp;
169
170 if ((hp = gethostbyname(name)) != NULL) {
171#ifndef h_addr
172 hlist[0] = (bpf_u_int32 *)hp->h_addr;
173 NTOHL(hp->h_addr);
174 return hlist;
175#else
176 for (p = (bpf_u_int32 **)hp->h_addr_list; *p; ++p)
177 NTOHL(**p);
178 return (bpf_u_int32 **)hp->h_addr_list;
179#endif
180 }
181 else
182 return 0;
183}
184
185struct addrinfo *
186pcap_nametoaddrinfo(const char *name)
187{
188 struct addrinfo hints, *res;
189 int error;
190
191 memset(&hints, 0, sizeof(hints));
192 hints.ai_family = PF_UNSPEC;
193 hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_STREAM; /*not really*/
194 hints.ai_protocol = IPPROTO_TCP; /*not really*/
195 error = getaddrinfo(name, NULL, &hints, &res);
196 if (error)
197 return NULL;
198 else
199 return res;
200}
201
202/*
203 * Convert net name to internet address.
204 * Return 0 upon failure.
205 * XXX - not guaranteed to be thread-safe! See below for platforms
206 * on which it is thread-safe and on which it isn't.
207 */
208bpf_u_int32
209pcap_nametonetaddr(const char *name)
210{
211#ifdef _WIN32
212 /*
213 * There's no "getnetbyname()" on Windows.
214 *
215 * XXX - I guess we could use the BSD code to read
216 * C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc/networks, assuming
217 * that's its home on all the versions of Windows
218 * we use, but that file probably just has the loopback
219 * network on 127/24 on 99 44/100% of Windows machines.
220 *
221 * (Heck, these days it probably just has that on 99 44/100%
222 * of *UN*X* machines.)
223 */
224 return 0;
225#else
226 /*
227 * UN*X.
228 */
229 struct netent *np;
230 #if defined(HAVE_LINUX_GETNETBYNAME_R)
231 /*
232 * We have Linux's reentrant getnetbyname_r().
233 */
234 struct netent result_buf;
235 char buf[1024]; /* arbitrary size */
236 int h_errnoval;
237 int err;
238
239 err = getnetbyname_r(name, &result_buf, buf, sizeof buf, &np,
240 &h_errnoval);
241 if (err != 0) {
242 /*
243 * XXX - dynamically allocate the buffer, and make it
244 * bigger if we get ERANGE back?
245 */
246 return 0;
247 }
248 #elif defined(HAVE_SOLARIS_IRIX_GETNETBYNAME_R)
249 /*
250 * We have Solaris's and IRIX's reentrant getnetbyname_r().
251 */
252 struct netent result_buf;
253 char buf[1024]; /* arbitrary size */
254
255 np = getnetbyname_r(name, &result_buf, buf, (int)sizeof buf);
256 #elif defined(HAVE_AIX_GETNETBYNAME_R)
257 /*
258 * We have AIX's reentrant getnetbyname_r().
259 */
260 struct netent result_buf;
261 struct netent_data net_data;
262
263 if (getnetbyname_r(name, &result_buf, &net_data) == -1)
264 np = NULL;
265 else
266 np = &result_buf;
267 #else
268 /*
269 * We don't have any getnetbyname_r(); either we have a
270 * getnetbyname() that uses thread-specific data, in which
271 * case we're thread-safe (sufficiently recent FreeBSD,
272 * sufficiently recent Darwin-based OS, sufficiently recent
273 * HP-UX, sufficiently recent Tru64 UNIX), or we have the
274 * traditional getnetbyname() (everything else, including
275 * current NetBSD and OpenBSD), in which case we're not
276 * thread-safe.
277 */
278 np = getnetbyname(name);
279 #endif
280 if (np != NULL)
281 return np->n_net;
282 else
283 return 0;
284#endif /* _WIN32 */
285}
286
287/*
288 * Convert a port name to its port and protocol numbers.
289 * We assume only TCP or UDP.
290 * Return 0 upon failure.
291 */
292int
293pcap_nametoport(const char *name, int *port, int *proto)
294{
295 struct addrinfo hints, *res, *ai;
296 int error;
297 struct sockaddr_in *in4;
298#ifdef INET6
299 struct sockaddr_in6 *in6;
300#endif
301 int tcp_port = -1;
302 int udp_port = -1;
303
304 /*
305 * We check for both TCP and UDP in case there are
306 * ambiguous entries.
307 */
308 memset(&hints, 0, sizeof(hints));
309 hints.ai_family = PF_UNSPEC;
310 hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_STREAM;
311 hints.ai_protocol = IPPROTO_TCP;
312 error = getaddrinfo(NULL, name, &hints, &res);
313 if (error != 0) {
314 if (error != EAI_NONAME &&
315 error != EAI_SERVICE) {
316 /*
317 * This is a real error, not just "there's
318 * no such service name".
319 * XXX - this doesn't return an error string.
320 */
321 return 0;
322 }
323 } else {
324 /*
325 * OK, we found it. Did it find anything?
326 */
327 for (ai = res; ai != NULL; ai = ai->ai_next) {
328 /*
329 * Does it have an address?
330 */
331 if (ai->ai_addr != NULL) {
332 /*
333 * Yes. Get a port number; we're done.
334 */
335 if (ai->ai_addr->sa_family == AF_INET) {
336 in4 = (struct sockaddr_in *)ai->ai_addr;
337 tcp_port = ntohs(in4->sin_port);
338 break;
339 }
340#ifdef INET6
341 if (ai->ai_addr->sa_family == AF_INET6) {
342 in6 = (struct sockaddr_in6 *)ai->ai_addr;
343 tcp_port = ntohs(in6->sin6_port);
344 break;
345 }
346#endif
347 }
348 }
349 freeaddrinfo(res);
350 }
351
352 memset(&hints, 0, sizeof(hints));
353 hints.ai_family = PF_UNSPEC;
354 hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_DGRAM;
355 hints.ai_protocol = IPPROTO_UDP;
356 error = getaddrinfo(NULL, name, &hints, &res);
357 if (error != 0) {
358 if (error != EAI_NONAME &&
359 error != EAI_SERVICE) {
360 /*
361 * This is a real error, not just "there's
362 * no such service name".
363 * XXX - this doesn't return an error string.
364 */
365 return 0;
366 }
367 } else {
368 /*
369 * OK, we found it. Did it find anything?
370 */
371 for (ai = res; ai != NULL; ai = ai->ai_next) {
372 /*
373 * Does it have an address?
374 */
375 if (ai->ai_addr != NULL) {
376 /*
377 * Yes. Get a port number; we're done.
378 */
379 if (ai->ai_addr->sa_family == AF_INET) {
380 in4 = (struct sockaddr_in *)ai->ai_addr;
381 udp_port = ntohs(in4->sin_port);
382 break;
383 }
384#ifdef INET6
385 if (ai->ai_addr->sa_family == AF_INET6) {
386 in6 = (struct sockaddr_in6 *)ai->ai_addr;
387 udp_port = ntohs(in6->sin6_port);
388 break;
389 }
390#endif
391 }
392 }
393 freeaddrinfo(res);
394 }
395
396 /*
397 * We need to check /etc/services for ambiguous entries.
398 * If we find an ambiguous entry, and it has the
399 * same port number, change the proto to PROTO_UNDEF
400 * so both TCP and UDP will be checked.
401 */
402 if (tcp_port >= 0) {
403 *port = tcp_port;
404 *proto = IPPROTO_TCP;
405 if (udp_port >= 0) {
406 if (udp_port == tcp_port)
407 *proto = PROTO_UNDEF;
408#ifdef notdef
409 else
410 /* Can't handle ambiguous names that refer
411 to different port numbers. */
412 warning("ambiguous port %s in /etc/services",
413 name);
414#endif
415 }
416 return 1;
417 }
418 if (udp_port >= 0) {
419 *port = udp_port;
420 *proto = IPPROTO_UDP;
421 return 1;
422 }
423#if defined(ultrix) || defined(__osf__)
424 /* Special hack in case NFS isn't in /etc/services */
425 if (strcmp(name, "nfs") == 0) {
426 *port = 2049;
427 *proto = PROTO_UNDEF;
428 return 1;
429 }
430#endif
431 return 0;
432}
433
434/*
435 * Convert a string in the form PPP-PPP, where correspond to ports, to
436 * a starting and ending port in a port range.
437 * Return 0 on failure.
438 */
439int
440pcap_nametoportrange(const char *name, int *port1, int *port2, int *proto)
441{
442 u_int p1, p2;
443 char *off, *cpy;
444 int save_proto;
445
446 if (sscanf(name, "%d-%d", &p1, &p2) != 2) {
447 if ((cpy = strdup(name)) == NULL)
448 return 0;
449
450 if ((off = strchr(cpy, '-')) == NULL) {
451 free(cpy);
452 return 0;
453 }
454
455 *off = '\0';
456
457 if (pcap_nametoport(cpy, port1, proto) == 0) {
458 free(cpy);
459 return 0;
460 }
461 save_proto = *proto;
462
463 if (pcap_nametoport(off + 1, port2, proto) == 0) {
464 free(cpy);
465 return 0;
466 }
467 free(cpy);
468
469 if (*proto != save_proto)
470 *proto = PROTO_UNDEF;
471 } else {
472 *port1 = p1;
473 *port2 = p2;
474 *proto = PROTO_UNDEF;
475 }
476
477 return 1;
478}
479
480/*
481 * XXX - not guaranteed to be thread-safe! See below for platforms
482 * on which it is thread-safe and on which it isn't.
483 */
484int
485pcap_nametoproto(const char *str)
486{
487 struct protoent *p;
488 #if defined(HAVE_LINUX_GETNETBYNAME_R)
489 /*
490 * We have Linux's reentrant getprotobyname_r().
491 */
492 struct protoent result_buf;
493 char buf[1024]; /* arbitrary size */
494 int err;
495
496 err = getprotobyname_r(str, &result_buf, buf, sizeof buf, &p);
497 if (err != 0) {
498 /*
499 * XXX - dynamically allocate the buffer, and make it
500 * bigger if we get ERANGE back?
501 */
502 return 0;
503 }
504 #elif defined(HAVE_SOLARIS_IRIX_GETNETBYNAME_R)
505 /*
506 * We have Solaris's and IRIX's reentrant getprotobyname_r().
507 */
508 struct protoent result_buf;
509 char buf[1024]; /* arbitrary size */
510
511 p = getprotobyname_r(str, &result_buf, buf, (int)sizeof buf);
512 #elif defined(HAVE_AIX_GETNETBYNAME_R)
513 /*
514 * We have AIX's reentrant getprotobyname_r().
515 */
516 struct protoent result_buf;
517 struct protoent_data proto_data;
518
519 if (getprotobyname_r(str, &result_buf, &proto_data) == -1)
520 p = NULL;
521 else
522 p = &result_buf;
523 #else
524 /*
525 * We don't have any getprotobyname_r(); either we have a
526 * getprotobyname() that uses thread-specific data, in which
527 * case we're thread-safe (sufficiently recent FreeBSD,
528 * sufficiently recent Darwin-based OS, sufficiently recent
529 * HP-UX, sufficiently recent Tru64 UNIX, Windows), or we have
530 * the traditional getprotobyname() (everything else, including
531 * current NetBSD and OpenBSD), in which case we're not
532 * thread-safe.
533 */
534 p = getprotobyname(str);
535 #endif
536 if (p != 0)
537 return p->p_proto;
538 else
539 return PROTO_UNDEF;
540}
541
542#include "ethertype.h"
543
544struct eproto {
545 const char *s;
546 u_short p;
547};
548
549/*
550 * Static data base of ether protocol types.
551 * tcpdump used to import this, and it's declared as an export on
552 * Debian, at least, so make it a public symbol, even though we
553 * don't officially export it by declaring it in a header file.
554 * (Programs *should* do this themselves, as tcpdump now does.)
555 *
556 * We declare it here, right before defining it, to squelch any
557 * warnings we might get from compilers about the lack of a
558 * declaration.
559 */
560PCAP_API struct eproto eproto_db[];
561PCAP_API_DEF struct eproto eproto_db[] = {
562 { "pup", ETHERTYPE_PUP },
563 { "xns", ETHERTYPE_NS },
564 { "ip", ETHERTYPE_IP },
565#ifdef INET6
566 { "ip6", ETHERTYPE_IPV6 },
567#endif
568 { "arp", ETHERTYPE_ARP },
569 { "rarp", ETHERTYPE_REVARP },
570 { "sprite", ETHERTYPE_SPRITE },
571 { "mopdl", ETHERTYPE_MOPDL },
572 { "moprc", ETHERTYPE_MOPRC },
573 { "decnet", ETHERTYPE_DN },
574 { "lat", ETHERTYPE_LAT },
575 { "sca", ETHERTYPE_SCA },
576 { "lanbridge", ETHERTYPE_LANBRIDGE },
577 { "vexp", ETHERTYPE_VEXP },
578 { "vprod", ETHERTYPE_VPROD },
579 { "atalk", ETHERTYPE_ATALK },
580 { "atalkarp", ETHERTYPE_AARP },
581 { "loopback", ETHERTYPE_LOOPBACK },
582 { "decdts", ETHERTYPE_DECDTS },
583 { "decdns", ETHERTYPE_DECDNS },
584 { (char *)0, 0 }
585};
586
587int
588pcap_nametoeproto(const char *s)
589{
590 struct eproto *p = eproto_db;
591
592 while (p->s != 0) {
593 if (strcmp(p->s, s) == 0)
594 return p->p;
595 p += 1;
596 }
597 return PROTO_UNDEF;
598}
599
600#include "llc.h"
601
602/* Static data base of LLC values. */
603static struct eproto llc_db[] = {
604 { "iso", LLCSAP_ISONS },
605 { "stp", LLCSAP_8021D },
606 { "ipx", LLCSAP_IPX },
607 { "netbeui", LLCSAP_NETBEUI },
608 { (char *)0, 0 }
609};
610
611int
612pcap_nametollc(const char *s)
613{
614 struct eproto *p = llc_db;
615
616 while (p->s != 0) {
617 if (strcmp(p->s, s) == 0)
618 return p->p;
619 p += 1;
620 }
621 return PROTO_UNDEF;
622}
623
624/* Hex digit to 8-bit unsigned integer. */
625static inline u_char
626xdtoi(u_char c)
627{
628 if (isdigit(c))
629 return (u_char)(c - '0');
630 else if (islower(c))
631 return (u_char)(c - 'a' + 10);
632 else
633 return (u_char)(c - 'A' + 10);
634}
635
636int
637__pcap_atoin(const char *s, bpf_u_int32 *addr)
638{
639 u_int n;
640 int len;
641
642 *addr = 0;
643 len = 0;
644 for (;;) {
645 n = 0;
646 while (*s && *s != '.')
647 n = n * 10 + *s++ - '0';
648 *addr <<= 8;
649 *addr |= n & 0xff;
650 len += 8;
651 if (*s == '\0')
652 return len;
653 ++s;
654 }
655 /* NOTREACHED */
656}
657
658int
659__pcap_atodn(const char *s, bpf_u_int32 *addr)
660{
661#define AREASHIFT 10
662#define AREAMASK 0176000
663#define NODEMASK 01777
664
665 u_int node, area;
666
667 if (sscanf(s, "%d.%d", &area, &node) != 2)
668 return(0);
669
670 *addr = (area << AREASHIFT) & AREAMASK;
671 *addr |= (node & NODEMASK);
672
673 return(32);
674}
675
676/*
677 * Convert 's', which can have the one of the forms:
678 *
679 * "xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx"
680 * "xx.xx.xx.xx.xx.xx"
681 * "xx-xx-xx-xx-xx-xx"
682 * "xxxx.xxxx.xxxx"
683 * "xxxxxxxxxxxx"
684 *
685 * (or various mixes of ':', '.', and '-') into a new
686 * ethernet address. Assumes 's' is well formed.
687 */
688u_char *
689pcap_ether_aton(const char *s)
690{
691 register u_char *ep, *e;
692 register u_char d;
693
694 e = ep = (u_char *)malloc(6);
695 if (e == NULL)
696 return (NULL);
697
698 while (*s) {
699 if (*s == ':' || *s == '.' || *s == '-')
700 s += 1;
701 d = xdtoi(*s++);
702 if (isxdigit((unsigned char)*s)) {
703 d <<= 4;
704 d |= xdtoi(*s++);
705 }
706 *ep++ = d;
707 }
708
709 return (e);
710}
711
712#ifndef HAVE_ETHER_HOSTTON
713/*
714 * Roll our own.
715 * XXX - not thread-safe, because pcap_next_etherent() isn't thread-
716 * safe! Needs a mutex or a thread-safe pcap_next_etherent().
717 */
718u_char *
719pcap_ether_hostton(const char *name)
720{
721 register struct pcap_etherent *ep;
722 register u_char *ap;
723 static FILE *fp = NULL;
724 static int init = 0;
725
726 if (!init) {
727 fp = fopen(PCAP_ETHERS_FILE, "r");
728 ++init;
729 if (fp == NULL)
730 return (NULL);
731 } else if (fp == NULL)
732 return (NULL);
733 else
734 rewind(fp);
735
736 while ((ep = pcap_next_etherent(fp)) != NULL) {
737 if (strcmp(ep->name, name) == 0) {
738 ap = (u_char *)malloc(6);
739 if (ap != NULL) {
740 memcpy(ap, ep->addr, 6);
741 return (ap);
742 }
743 break;
744 }
745 }
746 return (NULL);
747}
748#else
749/*
750 * Use the OS-supplied routine.
751 * This *should* be thread-safe; the API doesn't have a static buffer.
752 */
753u_char *
754pcap_ether_hostton(const char *name)
755{
756 register u_char *ap;
757 u_char a[6];
758
759 ap = NULL;
760 if (ether_hostton(name, (struct ether_addr *)a) == 0) {
761 ap = (u_char *)malloc(6);
762 if (ap != NULL)
763 memcpy((char *)ap, (char *)a, 6);
764 }
765 return (ap);
766}
767#endif
768
769/*
770 * XXX - not guaranteed to be thread-safe!
771 */
772int
773#ifdef DECNETLIB
774__pcap_nametodnaddr(const char *name, u_short *res)
775{
776 struct nodeent *getnodebyname();
777 struct nodeent *nep;
778
779 nep = getnodebyname(name);
780 if (nep == ((struct nodeent *)0))
781 return(0);
782
783 memcpy((char *)res, (char *)nep->n_addr, sizeof(unsigned short));
784 return(1);
785#else
786__pcap_nametodnaddr(const char *name _U_, u_short *res _U_)
787{
788 return(0);
789#endif
790}
791
